Hey Paige, great work on this ticket overall.
I think you gave them the correct answer, but they did not totally understand it, because it was exactly what they were asking for.
When creating a form, even if it is not to update contacts, the latest information that is entered will replace the information already within the contact info. That so, by submitting a form, they would be able to change their own information, without a manual task on the client's end, all automatic from the user.
The only thing they need would be to have their email address mandatory, and all the rest optional, so that they don't have to re-enter all the information, and simply the one they would like to update.
That's why I think, in your second answer, detailing a little bit more the process with the form you added as a screenshot (good idea by the way), may have helped them understand what you were trying to explain.

Hi George!

This first response is really well written - The first line shows that you read their message and are ready to respond.

As far as resolving the issue, you got most of the way there. You checked their account and it looks like their account is active. The one hint that something is amiss is that they are talking about a payment now but their plan doesn't renew until the 26th. It's easy to miss though! Make sure to cross-check the dates and even look on Adyen to see what payments were made.

Since this is the second time you respond to this client in this thread, I don't think the first line is totally necessary. If you think of this as a conversation in-person, it doesn't make a lot of sense to recap what you already said before. A simple \"thanks for getting back to me\" or \"thank you for that additional clarification\" should be enough on a second response.

We're still missing the fact that they aren't able to renew their payment, but checking to see how many credits they sent during this period is a good idea!

You provided instructions for how to get more credits which is good, although I'm not sure what you mean by \"requesting a reduction in email credit at the beginning of the next billing cycle\" since they ran out of credits...

It's good to set expectations for how long it will take for us to get an answer when you escalate, but I don't think you need to go into too many details. A simple \"I will escalate this to our technical team and get back to you as soon as possible\" should do.

I see that Raf suggested you add 10k email credits to their account. We would only do this if we know for sure it's a bug or error on our end. So for the first few months make sure to check before you do that 😃

Two small grammar/spelling notes - You say \"thank you for your patience\" twice, which isn't necessary. You only need to say it once! It's counter-productive to over-apologize.

And one time you wrote \"patients\" instead 😉

Your macro is very clear and detailed, so that's a really good start.
You'll want to make sure to personalize your reply a bit more however, based on what you see from the results on their Spamcheck report. Here, the client had a super high % of hard bounces on their campaign, so you do need to make sure to let them know that is what caused it. This way they understand that it's really their responsibility and that we're basing ourselves on hard data.

Aside from this, they did mention \"blocked\" contacts but here I'm pretty sure that they just meant \"flagged\", not actually blocklisted. Thanks !

Here the client mentioned that their contacts had been rejected. So the first thing you want to check is their BO notes to see if they have flagged contacts, which they did. Hi Cindy! Flagged contact cases are never easy 😅 Let's jump into this one.

Your first response is solid, the standard response for flagged contacts. But I think the second response is where we can do things a little differently.

The client gave an example of a specific contact. Responding to that specific question was was needed. It looks like they deleted the contact now, but even if they hadn't at the time, you need to at least acknowledge that you looked into the example they gave. This helps show the customer that we are taking their request seriously and truly listening to their concern. And for that specific contact, you could have explained that it's the whole list that gets flagged, not individual contacts. So even though the example they give is most likely not a bad contact, that's why it was flagged anyway.

The 2-hour recommendation you gave I'm not sure applies to this situation. I believe you are referring to when someone imports contacts, they might not be able to send to them right away. But that's a different process than spamcheck and contacts being flagged, so I don't think that was warranted here.

Good instinct to provide pictures to help illustrate your points! The screenshot you provided of the report and your explanation is a little confusing though. You mention that the screenshot shows that the campaign was sent to the entire list, but it shows that only part of the emails were delivered. I know what you meant, but the client probably didn't. The screenshot also doesn't show the unsubs, which would probably have been a good idea to include since you mention that is the reason the contacts were flagged.

Like I said, flagged contact tickets aren't fun, but I think these changes could help for future cases. Let me know what you think!

reviews.comment: Although you were not able to find a fix for the client, you did the most you could do by escalating (in DM?) and making sure you went to the bottom of the matter. Well done!

thread.comment: @Emily S. Yes, actually, I believe that I had a one on one with Kaisha and we went over this ticket together in a google meeting. :)

reviews.comment: Great ticket here on both the plan and te removal of the logo, I think you have done very well and they were very satisfied!

Hey Paige, great work on this ticket overall.
I think you gave them the correct answer, but they did not totally understand it, because it was exactly what they were asking for.
When creating a form, even if it is not to update contacts, the latest information that is entered will replace the information already within the contact info. That so, by submitting a form, they would be able to change their own information, without a manual task on the client's end, all automatic from the user.
The only thing they need would be to have their email address mandatory, and all the rest optional, so that they don't have to re-enter all the information, and simply the one they would like to update.
That's why I think, in your second answer, detailing a little bit more the process with the form you added as a screenshot (good idea by the way), may have helped them understand what you were trying to explain.
Great feedback and information about how the SMTP works for this client !
Excellent feedback and clarification on the way we operate compared to Mailchimp, very useful for them.
Pretty simple activation here, all good !

Hi George!

This first response is really well written - The first line shows that you read their message and are ready to respond.

As far as resolving the issue, you got most of the way there. You checked their account and it looks like their account is active. The one hint that something is amiss is that they are talking about a payment now but their plan doesn't renew until the 26th. It's easy to miss though! Make sure to cross-check the dates and even look on Adyen to see what payments were made.

Since this is the second time you respond to this client in this thread, I don't think the first line is totally necessary. If you think of this as a conversation in-person, it doesn't make a lot of sense to recap what you already said before. A simple "thanks for getting back to me" or "thank you for that additional clarification" should be enough on a second response.

We're still missing the fact that they aren't able to renew their payment, but checking to see how many credits they sent during this period is a good idea!

You provided instructions for how to get more credits which is good, although I'm not sure what you mean by "requesting a reduction in email credit at the beginning of the next billing cycle" since they ran out of credits...

Here I think it's good you owned up to the error!

It's good to set expectations for how long it will take for us to get an answer when you escalate, but I don't think you need to go into too many details. A simple "I will escalate this to our technical team and get back to you as soon as possible" should do.

I see that Raf suggested you add 10k email credits to their account. We would only do this if we know for sure it's a bug or error on our end. So for the first few months make sure to check before you do that 😃

Two small grammar/spelling notes - You say "thank you for your patience" twice, which isn't necessary. You only need to say it once! It's counter-productive to over-apologize.

And one time you wrote "patients" instead 😉

comments.comment: Then it was resolved! See how you get straight to the point here, since it's an ongoing discussion. That's perfect (compared to the 2nd response)

reviews.comment:
Your macro is very clear and detailed, so that's a really good start.
You'll want to make sure to personalize your reply a bit more however, based on what you see from the results on their Spamcheck report. Here, the client had a super high % of hard bounces on their campaign, so you do need to make sure to let them know that is what caused it. This way they understand that it's really their responsibility and that we're basing ourselves on hard data.

Aside from this, they did mention "blocked" contacts but here I'm pretty sure that they just meant "flagged", not actually blocklisted. Thanks !
Simple and efficient. Good support!
Great support!

Here the client mentioned that their contacts had been rejected. So the first thing you want to check is their BO notes to see if they have flagged contacts, which they did. Make sure to also update the internal category of the ticket to what the client's request is about (CAMP - Suspended in this case). Thanks !

Your macro for flagged contacts is good otherwise, very informative.
Good job!

Hi Cristina!

Straightforward refusal - Thanks for selecting the right internal category and for leaving a note in the BO as to why you refused them!

Hi Cindy! Flagged contact cases are never easy 😅 Let's jump into this one.

Your first response is solid, the standard response for flagged contacts. But I think the second response is where we can do things a little differently.

The client gave an example of a specific contact. Responding to that specific question was was needed. It looks like they deleted the contact now, but even if they hadn't at the time, you need to at least acknowledge that you looked into the example they gave. This helps show the customer that we are taking their request seriously and truly listening to their concern. And for that specific contact, you could have explained that it's the whole list that gets flagged, not individual contacts. So even though the example they give is most likely not a bad contact, that's why it was flagged anyway.

The 2-hour recommendation you gave I'm not sure applies to this situation. I believe you are referring to when someone imports contacts, they might not be able to send to them right away. But that's a different process than spamcheck and contacts being flagged, so I don't think that was warranted here.

Good instinct to provide pictures to help illustrate your points! The screenshot you provided of the report and your explanation is a little confusing though. You mention that the screenshot shows that the campaign was sent to the entire list, but it shows that only part of the emails were delivered. I know what you meant, but the client probably didn't. The screenshot also doesn't show the unsubs, which would probably have been a good idea to include since you mention that is the reason the contacts were flagged.

Like I said, flagged contact tickets aren't fun, but I think these changes could help for future cases. Let me know what you think!

Hi Cheryl! Simple refusal - Good job selecting the right internal category and leaving a note in BO as to why you refused the account. And I agree with you, there was no need to respond to the last reply from the client.
Hey Capucine! Not leaving any feedback since it's your last week 😢 Giving you 100% though 😉
